items.author: Shawn Levy
items.content: A hard and bright and tough film in all the best ways.

items.author: Mark Caro
items.content: A puzzle movie in which the puzzle is actually worth the time and effort to solve.

items.author: Ella Taylor
items.content: If nothing else, Memento is a savvy comment on the queasy uncertainties of the postmodern condition, in which history goes no further back than yesterday's news, and knowledge is supplanted by "information" from a tumult of spin-controlled, unreliable narrators.

items.author: Edward Guthmann
items.content: Bound to be talked about, debated and eviscerated far more than it's understood.

items.author: Richard Schickel
items.content: The film takes this attempt to shatter narrative into little pieces about as far into incoherence as it can go; yet it is also full of odd, hypnotic menace.

items.author: Gregory Weinkauf
items.content: Feels mostly like an audacious prank.

items.author: Marjorie Baumgarten
items.content: Once you've seen it all once I bet you'll wish you were watching "Groundhog Day" -- again.
